snippet: Mahinda Rajapaksa, who was voted out of office in January, is trying to become prime minister, but opponents are determined to bury his political hopes once and for all.
abstract: Sri Lanka's former Pres Mahinda Rajapaksa puts forth optimistic outlook that voters will return him to power as prime minister in coming parliamentary election, despite myriad indications of his diminished political stature; sitting Pres Maithripala Sirisena has stated explicitly that Rajapaksa is unfit for office.
lead_paragraph: Mahinda Rajapaksa, who was voted out of office in January, is trying to become prime minister, but opponents are determined to bury his political hopes once and for all.

headline.main: Comeback Hopes Dim for Mahinda Rajapaksa, Sri Lanka’s Ex-President
headline.print_headline: Comeback Hopes Dim for Sri Lanka’s Ex-President
